items.text: length outside off, tries to cut but gets it off the bottom of the bat to point
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: length on middle and picked up nicely towards deep square leg despite the lack of bounce there, the fielder had to make some ground to his left, so that was good for two
length on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
length outside off, hint of away swing for de Grandhomme there, pushed to point
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: length closer to off stump, defended to point
items.postText: It's drinks and over to Liam once again
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText:
UJack: "If Bangladesh can build a partnership here and go into the last 10 with six wickets in hand, I reckon some big damage will be possible. " Wickets in hand, platform laid. Yep, that's how the formula usually works.

naser: "Mithun has yet to play a match winnings innings for bangladesh. he had good start in last match too, but throwed it way. if doesn't perform today, sabbir is sitting on the bench. i am also surprised they didn't pick sabbir today the guy who scored hundred against nz in their last match. "

Syed: "Still feel like BD can get a score close to or over 300. As long as these two stay and set the base, I feel they have the talent in them to accelerate"

Santner will continue after drinks...
items.text: eased down to long on, just the one

items.preText: Faraz Ahmad: "OMG Liam, you were commentating in India vs SA today, busy day for you. Now I know when you take break between the overs, you are actually busy somewhere else. Well done guys, love you all for bringing updates to us in awesome way! Hats off. " -- It is a World Cup after all! All hands on deck
items.text: slower through the air, and Mithun is forward to smother it to leg
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: tossed up at 82km/h, outside off, and a neat little drive brings a single through cover
dabbed down towards point, and any thoughts of a quick single are quickly quashed
quicker, flatter and it's kept out into the leg side

items.preText: Chintan Parekh: "What a spell has been this from Santner, Has kept the run flow in check and built the pressure" -- His efforts will also encourage Bangladesh's twirlymen later on
items.text: punched down to long off, and Mahmudullah keeps strike

items.preText: Ben: "Williamson has been holding back his quicks. He can now use them til the end. It's going to be tough for the Bangladesh lower order to accelerate." And here's one of them. Boult comes back for another spell.
items.text: and his loosener is a short one outside off, Mahmudullah dropping his hands to let it through
dead-batted towards the covers, and there's room for a scampered single

items.preText: Ahmed : "How good has Santner been today? Been doing the same for NZ consistently since the last World Cup. "
items.text: pushed through full, on off stump, and Mithun works it watchfully back to the bowler, who collects in his follow through
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: swatted out to deep backward square, on the pull. It was a short one from Boult, but without serious licks and Mithun looked well in control
cutter, and it squares Mahmudullah up a touch as it breaks across him

items.preText: Juwel: "Keep calm and just rotate the strike. Come on Bangladesh, come on finisher Riyadh."
items.text: and another bumper to end a solid comeback over from Boult, Mahmudullah swaying out of the way. Just two from the over

items.preText: Double change, Williamson bringing both of his openers back. Here's Henry
items.text: and he hits a good length straight away, Mithun coming forward to have a look at it
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Mohammad Irfan: "Mitchel Santner, 20 for 1 in 7 overs, that is indeed a good news for Bangladesh, specially when you have 2 full time and 2 part time spinners in the squad.."
items.text: lapped to short fine leg! Mithun walked across into position, and scooped a length ball in the air and very fine. It's all in the wrist
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: and a watchful follow-up from Mithun, prodding a defensive stroke as Henry aims for the top of off
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: chipped in the air, but it plugs in the outfield, and it's just two. Good shot though, with mid on up
there's a speculative appeal from Henry as a length delivery skids on to beat Mithun's pull ... but Umpire Oxenford isn't the least bit interested. Too high
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Nitish : "I understand that Southee is still regaining his fitness, but once he is fit, i hope he doesn't replace Henry. Yes, Southee does bring a lot of experience to the side, but in the 4 yrs between World cups 2015 & 2019, Henry has outdone his senior--in this period Southee took 54 wickets in 45 matches but Henry has taken 55 wickets in just 33 matches at a similar economy rate. Where Henry really stands out is his strike rate of 31.3 compared to Southee's 43.4. Replacing Henry with Southee "
items.text: tapped to cover, but there's no room for a single
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Aman: "@Ahmed I would advice you to save 3d glasses for this match. There is still a lot to play. As far as Godzilla is concerned, it can be best enjoyed in 4DX." -- Have I missed something?
items.text: a length ball leaps up at Mahmudullah's splice, rolling slowly towards gully. No run
nothing happening for Boult through the air, but his line and length are spot on and Mahmudullah can only defend
